channel.title: Databases
channel.description:
basically, i have 2 tables in my database: tblfamilies and tblaupairs
tblaupairs: [IMG]http://puu.sh/gBL5p/a9fa532856.png[/img] tblfamilies: [IMG]http://puu.sh/gBL9Q/b29473f492.png[/img]
what i'm trying to do is search through both tables: if the value of Driver and Drive in both tables are the same and if the value of Smoker and Smoke in both tables are the same
then i just want to output the name of that family and the name of that aupair.
the database is a just a localhost wamp server

item.title: Databases
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

[code]public void readData() {
connect();
DefaultTableModel table = (DefaultTableModel) jTable1.getModel();
try {
Connection connection = DriverManager.getConnection(Constants.HOST, Constants.USERNAME, Constants.PASSWORD);
Statement statement = connection.createStatement();
String query = “SELECT tblaupairs.Name, tblfamilies.name FROM tblaupairs JOIN tblfamilies ON tblaupairs.Smoke = tblfamilies.Smoker WHERE tblaupairs.Drive = tblfamilies.Driver”;
ResultSet resultSet = statement.executeQuery(query);

        while(resultSet.next()) {
           String aupairName = resultSet.getString(1);
           String familyName = resultSet.getString(2);
           table.addRow(new Object[]{aupairName, familyName});
        }
        
        connection.close();
        statement.close();
        resultSet.close();
    } catch(SQLException e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
    }
}[/code]

should work

Read full topic

item.title: Databases
item.dc:creator: @James-RevolutionX James-RevolutionX
item.description:
@James-RevolutionX wrote:

[quote=“Zymus, post:2, topic:550588”][quote author=James-RevolutionX link=topic=669500.msg4476907#msg4476907 date=1426453055]
basically, i have 2 tables in my database: tblfamilies and tblaupairs

tblaupairs:
tblfamilies:

what i’m trying to do is search through both tables:
if the value of Driver and Drive in both tables are the same and
if the value of Smoker and Smoke in both tables are the same

then i just want to output the name of that family and the name of that aupair.

the database is a just a localhost wamp server

[/quote]

SELECT * FROM tblaupairs JOIN tblfamilies ON tblaupairs.Smoke = tblfamilies.Smoker WHERE tblaupairs.Drive = tblfamilies.Driver [/quote]

thanks, but it isn’t working.

i have this: [code] public void readData() {
connect();
DefaultTableModel table = (DefaultTableModel) jTable1.getModel();
try {
Connection connection = DriverManager.getConnection(Constants.HOST, Constants.USERNAME, Constants.PASSWORD);
Statement statement = connection.createStatement();
String query = “SELECT * FROM tblaupairs JOIN tblfamilies ON tblaupairs.Smoke = tblfamilies.Smoker WHERE tblaupairs.Drive = tblfamilies.Driver”;
ResultSet resultSet = statement.executeQuery(query);

        while(resultSet.next()) {
           String name = resultSet.getString("Name");
           table.addRow(new Object[]{name});
        }
        
        connection.close();
        statement.close();
        resultSet.close();
    } catch(SQLException e) {
        
    }
}[/code]

but it only outputs the names of the aupair table, where i need the names of both the aupair and families, in this format:

Read full topic

tblaupairs:
tblfamilies:

what i’m trying to do is search through both tables:
if the value of Driver and Drive in both tables are the same and
if the value of Smoker and Smoke in both tables are the same

then i just want to output the name of that family and the name of that aupair.

the database is a just a localhost wamp server[/quote]

SELECT *
FROM tblaupairs
JOIN tblfamilies
ON tblaupairs.Smoke = tblfamilies.Smoker
WHERE tblaupairs.Drive = tblfamilies.Driver
